interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Review Date: 2018/05/29
Average Rating: 4.6
Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English Dialogue Boost: High', 'English', 'English Dialogue Boost: Medium'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Martin McDonagh'], 'Producers': ['Graham Broadbent', 'Pete Czernin', 'Martin McDonagh'], 'Starring': ['Frances McDormand', 'Woody Harrelson', 'Sam Rockwell'], 'Studio': ['Searchlight']}
Review Text: I watched this movie last night and really didn't know what to expect, but that it had a lot of Oscar buzz around it. The performances were solid, the plot was ok, but it was not darkly comedic at all- only a sad portrayal of a small town that is full of only curse words to me. There is more profanity in this movie than I have heard in quite some time. I also think the money spent on those billboards could be best spent on a private investigator or other means of finding out whodunnit than pointing fingers. I won't be watching it again or recommending it.
Review Title: Too Many Swear Words for Its Own Good
Rating: 3.0
--------------------------------------------------
reference_summary:
{'Content advisory': ['Substance use', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Greta Gerwig'], 'Producers': ['Eli Bush', "Evelyn O'Neill", 'Scott Rudin', 'Jason Sack', 'Alex G. Scott', 'Lila Yacoub'], 'Starring': ['Ronan', 'Saoirse', 'Laurie Metcalf'], 'Studio': ['A24 Distribution LLC']} I don't quite understand why this movie got the Oscar buzz it did. I feel like there are so many EXCELLENT and AMAZING under the radar teen movies that deserve Oscar credit than this mediocre film like Edge of Seventeen or even more recently Love, Simon.
Lady Bird tries to do much in one movie without a general vision. The character meanders and is often awful. I hate the relationship she has with her mom and her best friend. She treats everyone horribly.

SPOILER ALERT:

At the end, there is no life lessons learned by the main character; however, she becomes lonely and instead cow-tows to her mom, who was verbally abusive to her in the entire movie. That is a horrible lesson for any teen or any one else to take away from this movie. This character should have dropped her mom like it is hot and realized that she is better off without her belittling her all of the time and yelling in her face and demeaning her. I don't understand why this movie got so much buzz when the Edge of Seventeen deals with the tension between a mother and daughter in a much more mature and well-developed way. This movie leaves a lot to be desired. Why the Oscar Buzz? You can do much better for a movie tonight! Scream 4 Comedy, Horror, Eerie, Ominous ['Ten years have passed, and Sidney Prescott, who has put herself back together thanks in part to her writing, is visited by the Ghostface Killer.'] {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Wes Craven'], 'Producers': ['Wes Craven', 'Kevin Williamson', 'Iya Labunka'], 'Starring': ['Courteney Cox', 'David Arquette', 'Neve Campbell']} I really think the Scream series is entirely under-rated. I recently watched all 4 of them with my husband and we enjoyed them so much! They were a bit gory, but they have a ton of continuity between each movie, which was really a great thrill to watch unfold as you see the final killer in this movie. The movies do a great job of being campy, but having a seamless story to tell between each of the movies that is both epically horrific, but not so scary that I couldn't tolerate it. Their is love, loss, humor, and a few jump out of your seat moments to keep you at the edge of your seats. I highly recommend people re-watch the Scream movies because they are way better than the cheap horror movies that currently play in theaters. Retro Tale of Love, Loss, and Murder {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Peter Hutchings'], 'Producers': ['Victoria Bousis', 'Wendy Cox', 'Brice Dal Farra', 'Claude Dal Farra', 'Glenn W. Garland', 'Brian Keady', 'Kathleen E. Kearney', 'Christian Mercuri', 'Lauren Munsch'], 'Starring': ['Eden Sher', 'Victoria Justice', 'Peyton List'], 'Studio': ['Vision Films']} I LOVE Eden Sher, Sue Sue Heck, from The Middle, which I will miss so much once it stops airing later this year. I am also a fan of the other actors/actresses in the movie, but this movie doesn't do their talent justice (pun intended, given Victoria Justice is one of the leads). The movie cops to a lot of teen geek chick romance ploys and plot points and doesn't serve to stir up any new thought provoking ideas about bullies, nerds, and kids that are often forgotten. I have seen movies that cleverly discuss these ideals like Before I Fall, The DUFF, and Prom. I like this movie. It is forgettable, but good for a Sunday night movie popcorn theater at home. It is just not memorable, but does the trick in the moment. Forgettable Geek Chic, but You Can Do Better... {'Subtitles': ['None available'], 'Directors': ['Andy Devonshire'], 'Producers': ['Anna Beattie', 'Mark Drake', 'Anna Driver', 'Hannah Griffiths', 'Jake Senior', 'Samantha Beddoes', 'Helen Cawley'], 'Starring': ['Mel Giedroyc', 'Sue Perkins', 'Mary Berry'], 'Studio': ['PBS']} For anyone who likes cooking and baking competitions, this one is slightly different for a few reasons:
1) it is set in England
2) all of the deserts are things that I had never heard of before and very unique to watch being made from start to scratch (pun, intended)
3) The hosts are all engaging, except one
4) The contestants are not super competitive or mean with each other and help each other out when things go poorly. I love that in competitive shows.
5) This is great fun for anyone with an interest in food. Great British Introduction to Unusual Foods Across the Pond {'Content advisory': ['Alcohol use', 'foul language'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Charlie Mysak', 'Michael Fitzpatrick Lawrence Jr.', 'Nick Petrie'], 'Producers': ['John Dufresne-Williams', 'Montré Burton', 'Chris Lauer', 'Chris Coelen', 'Karrie Wolfe', 'Kimberly Goodman', 'Jason Sands'], 'Starring': ['Neil Bowlus', 'Joseph Cilona', 'Ashley Doherty']} Married at First Sight is a reality tv show where couples that have never met before are matched by professionals- a psychologist, a sexologist, and a sociologist- in an arranged marriage and see if they can make it work for 6 weeks- some couples survive, some don’t. You learn a TON about why people do the things they do and why relationships don’t work and some do work. I love it and learned a lot of great tips on how to improve my own relationships and provide guidance with others struggling in their own relationships. Excellent Reality TV with Real World Applications The Bletchley Circle: Cracking a Killer's Code . (Actor) Rated: PG-13 Format: DVD Movies & TV, Genre for Featured Categories, Mystery & Thrillers ['Product Description', 'Four women who worked as codebreakers at Bletchley Park have taken up civilian lives. Susan, has collated data about a series of murders. She tries to convince the police she knows where another body is, but they are unable to locate it and dismiss her. She turns to her three friends and they work out where the next victim will be taken, find the body, then decide they are the only ones who can track down the killer.', 'Amazon.com', 'After her days cracking Nazi codes at Bletchley Park during World War II, Susan Gray (Anna Maxwell Martin) finds life as a housewife lacking. When she perceives patterns in a series of killings, she approaches the police, only to be rebuffed. Horrified by the prospect of more women being murdered, Susan gathers three of her Bletchley cohorts--outspoken, independent Millie (Rachael Stirling,', 'Tipping the Velvet', '); Jean (Julie Graham), an administrator at Bletchley who still has connections in the British bureaucracy; and Lucy (Sophie Rundle), whose eidetic memory makes her a living computer. Their complementary skills allow them to deconstruct these grisly crimes, predicting where the killer may strike next and gradually unraveling where he came from… which brings them closer to the murderer than they ever expected.', "The Bletchley Circle: Cracking a Killer's Code", "cunningly mixes a gripping mystery with understated commentary on women's roles in society (or lack thereof). The social critique actually compounds the tension; the patronizing and dismissive attitude of the police and other men makes the serial killer's actions seem less like a derangement and more like the logical extreme of sexism. The writing, performances, and production are all top-notch; this is a smart, multilayered thriller. --", 'Bret Fetzer'] {'Genre': 'Mystery & Suspense/British Mystery Theater, Television/Crime', 'Format': 'Multiple Formats, Color, NTSC', 'Language': 'English', 'Number Of Discs': '1', 'Runtime': '2 hours and 15 minutes', 'Aspect Ratio': '1.78:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'PG-13 (Parents Strongly Cautioned)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 2.72 Ounces', 'Item model number': '7018838', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, Color, NTSC', 'Run time': '2 hours and 15 minutes', 'Release date': 'May 14, 2013', 'Subtitles': 'English', 'Studio': 'PBS', 'Number of discs': '1'} I saw Bletchley Circle last year and binge-watched them all within one week. They were so compelling, especially to know that there was a real Bletchley Circle back in the war. It was so addicting and you really want to know who the killer is in each season. I also want to mention there will be a Season 4 coming out soon! MUST WATCH SERIES!!!! Bletchley Circle: Season 2 Anna Maxwell Martin, Hattie Morahan, Rachael Stirling, Sophie Rundle, Julie Graham (Actor) Rated: PG-13 Format: DVD Movies & TV, Independently Distributed, Drama ['Watch two new code-breaking thrillers in The Bletchley Circle, Season 2. The series is based on the lives of four extraordinary and brilliant women who worked at top-secret HQ Bletchley Park during World War II.'] {'Genre': 'Mystery & Suspense/British Mystery Theater, Television/Crime', 'Format': 'Multiple Formats, Color, Dolby, NTSC, Widescreen', 'Contributor': 'Anna Maxwell Martin, Hattie Morahan, Rachael Stirling, Sophie Rundle, Julie Graham', 'Language': 'English', 'Number Of Discs': '2', 'Aspect Ratio': '1.78:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'PG-13 (Parents Strongly Cautioned)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 3.52 Ounces', 'Item model number': 'PBSDBLEC600DVD', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, Color, Dolby, NTSC, Widescreen', 'Run time': '3 hours', 'Release date': 'April 15, 2014', 'Actors': 'Anna Maxwell Martin, Hattie Morahan, Rachael Stirling, Sophie Rundle, Julie Graham', 'Subtitles': 'English', 'Studio': 'PBS (Direct)', 'Number of discs': '2'} I saw Bletchley Circle last year and binge-watched them all within one week. They were so compelling, especially to know that there was a real Bletchley Circle back in the war. It was so addicting and you really want to know who the killer is in each season. I also want to mention there will be a Season 4 coming out soon! MUST WATCH SERIES!!!! {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Michael Fields', 'Jason Bloom', 'Dan Etheridge', 'Michael Wale', 'Mairzee Almas', 'John T. Kretchmer', 'Viet Nguyen', 'Tessa Blake', 'Zetna Fuentes', 'Mark Piznarski'], 'Producers': ['Not Specified'], 'Starring': ['Rose McIver', 'Malcolm Goodwin', 'Rahul Kohli']} iZombie is probably one of the most underrated shows on television. Liv and her friends have amazing adventures akin to Veronica Mars with murder, treason, mayhem, and a little bit of humor thrown in. As the medical examiner, Liv eats the brain of her dead victim and takes on attributes of their personality, which lead to some of the most amusing acting that I have seen in recent years. No episode is the same and every episode each character grows and changes as they develop a new part of themselves by eating the brains of the newly departed. With romance abound and meta- commentary everywhere, iZombie really is so entertaining and makes for an amazing series that will surely be missed after it ends next season (season 4). How to Liv as a Zombie {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Lauren Belfer', 'Amy Rhodin', 'Tony Shaff', 'Alexis Charizopoulos', 'Allison Berg', 'Leslie Appleyard', 'Joe Stramowski', 'Brian Campbell', 'Amy Bonezzi', 'Kristen Schylinski']} I was addicted to Teen Mom 2 and their drama, but now it is just the same old same old from each girl. Chelsea is the only one who has her act together. The rest are just a mess with drugs, cheating, lying, and jail over and over. It is time to grow up and move on from this series. Time to Move on From Teen Mom 2 {'Audio languages': ['English Dialogue Boost: High', 'English', 'English Dialogue Boost: Medium'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Martin McDonagh'], 'Producers': ['Graham Broadbent', 'Pete Czernin', 'Martin McDonagh'], 'Starring': ['Frances McDormand', 'Woody Harrelson', 'Sam Rockwell'], 'Studio': ['Searchlight']} I watched this movie last night and really didn't know what to expect, but that it had a lot of Oscar buzz around it. The performances were solid, the plot was ok, but it was not darkly comedic at all- only a sad portrayal of a small town that is full of only curse words to me. There is more profanity in this movie than I have heard in quite some time. I also think the money spent on those billboards could be best spent on a private investigator or other means of finding out whodunnit than pointing fingers. I won't be watching it again or recommending it. Too Many Swear Words for Its Own Good
profile:
**Updated User Profile Summary:**

- **Film and Media Preferences:** The user continues to favor teen-centric narratives that delve into complex mother-daughter relationships, maintaining a strong engagement with reality TV but showing a notable shift toward seeking more meaningful content. Recently, they have developed an interest in historical crime dramas and mysteries with strong female leads, emphasizing the importance of innovative storytelling.

- **Critique Style:** They maintain a critical approach focused on character development, often challenging typical adolescent tropes. The user values narratives that blend suspense with depth but recently expressed disappointment in overt profanity and lack of substance in acclaimed works, particularly those within the crime drama genre.

- **Content Sensitivity:** The user remains sensitive to excessive use of foul language and substance abuse themes, preferring narratives that are uplifting and thought-provoking. They enjoy horror but are cautious about excessive gore and violence.

- **General Sentiment:** Seeking authenticity and depth, they often critique popular works for lacking in these areas while also appreciating originality and campy humor. 

- **Engagement with Culture:** Actively involved in discussions on interpersonal relationships, the user seeks narratives highlighting social issues and character evolution, reinforcing a commitment to diverse storytelling and strong female characters while distancing themselves from stagnant reality TV content. Their recent interaction further underscores their preference for narratives that are not only engaging but also respectful in terms of language and thematic depth.
